resources.string: DuckDuckGo\'s VPN secures all of your device\'s Internet traffic anytime, anywhere.
DuckDuckGo Network Protection is currently in beta. Share feedback to help us improve!
Network Protection is enabled and routing traffic through the VPN.

string.instruction: Placeholder is location of server with format City,Country

resources.string: Network Protection is enabled and routing device traffic through %1$s.
Network Protection interrupted. Attempting to reconnect now…
Network Protection failed to connect. Please try again later.
Network Protection is ON. Your location and online activity are protected.
Connection interrupted. Attempting to reconnect now…
Failed to connect. Please try again later.
Your VPN app may be disconnected
Android only allows one active VPN connection at a time. Enabling Network Protection may disconnect any active VPN on your device.
Your VPN app is blocking Network Protection
Android only allows one active VPN connection at a time. Open Network settings > VPN. Find the VPN app that’s “always-on” and disable it to continue.
Go to your device’s VPN Settings for DuckDuckGo and enable Always-on VPN to prevent Android disabling protection.\n\nMake sure to leave the other setting OFF.
To avoid app issues, go to your device\'s VPN Settings for DuckDuckGo and disable Block connections without VPN.
Network Protection is disabled.\nA VPN app on your device may have disabled it. Use the toggle to re-enable.
Action required! To avoid app issues, you need to change your Android settings. Change settings
Secure your network connection anytime, anywhere with Network Protection, the VPN from DuckDuckGo.\n\nJoin the waitlist, and we can notify you when it\'s your turn.
Error joining the Waitlist, please try again later
DuckDuckGo Network Protection is currently in closed, invite-only beta.
DuckDuckGo will never log, track, or share your network data.
Get a notification when you\'re invited to Network Protection.
Enter your invite code below to continue.
We didn\'t recognise this Invite Code.
Error redeeming code, please try again later
You\'re invited to try Network Protection beta!
New invites are sent every few days, on a first come first served basis.\n\nWe can notify you when your invite is ready.

Get an extra layer of protection online with the VPN built for speed and simplicity. Encrypt your internet connection across your entire device and hide your location and IP address from sites you visit.
Beta access is limited for now.
We send new invites every few days.
We can notify you when its your turn.
Encrypt online traffic across your browsers and apps.
Fast, reliable, and easy to use
No need for a separate app. Connect in one click and see your connection status at a glance.
We do not log or save any data that can connect you to your online activity.
Network Protection is free to use during beta.
Automatically restore a VPN connection after interruption
Let local traffic bypass the VPN and connect to devices on your local network, like a printer
Network Protection prevents DNS leaks to your Internet Service Provider by routing DNS queries though the VPN tunnel to our own resolver.
Display a persistent notification when the VPN is active
Get notified if your connection drops or VPN status changes
Network Protection works across all apps by default. If you’re experiencing app issues with Network Protection enabled, try disabling protection for that app.
App issues may occur if enabled

string.name: netpExclusionListManuallyDisableAppDialogLabel
string.instruction: Placeholder is the name of an app

resources.string: Please let us know if you disabled Network Protection for %1$s because you experienced app issues.\n\nWe\'ll also disable App Tracking Protection for %1$s.
Report an Issue With an App
This will update your custom protection settings and enable Network Protection for all apps. You can always change your protection settings again later.
Enabling protection sends the app\'s name to DuckDuckGo.

A virtual private network, commonly known as a VPN, protects your privacy and anonymity online by hiding your IP address so websites and apps can\'t identify you or your location by accessing your real IP address. VPNs also encrypt the data sent over your device\'s network connection so information that could otherwise reveal your identity or your online activities (e.g., the links you click, the files you download, or the messages you send) is obscured from others on the same network.\n\nUsing a VPN when connecting to public Wi-Fi, in places like coffee shops or airports, prevents your private information and browsing habits from being exposed to others on the network. Using a VPN on your home network hides your web browsing history from your Internet service provider, who could otherwise log and sell that information to third parties.

A VPN allows you to re-route your online activity through a remote server in another location operated by the VPN provider. This ensures that websites and apps see the remote server\'s IP address location instead of your real one. VPNs also encrypt (or scramble) data in-transit, so others can\'t read it.\n\nThere can be some drawbacks to using a VPN. Depending on how far away you are from the remote server, your Internet speed may be affected. Some websites and apps also intentionally limit access to people using a VPN. Additionally, some VPN providers may also log and share your online activity with 3rd parties. Using a VPN with a "no logging" privacy policy like DuckDuckGo\'s Network Protection is recommended.

Network Protection uses the open source WireGuard protocol to configure a virtual private network (VPN) on your device. When enabled, all of your device traffic is first encrypted and then routed through the nearest VPN server to protect your browsing activity from Internet service providers and hide your location from apps and sites you visit.
Is only my web browsing protected?
All of the network activity on your device is protected.
Does DuckDuckGo keep logs of my data?
No, we do not store logs.
Where are DuckDuckGo VPN servers located?
DuckDuckGo offers a limited number of servers while Network Protection is in beta, located in the United States and Europe.
Why can\'t I choose my server location?
Network Protection automatically selects the nearest server to you to maintain the highest connection speed possible while browsing.
Why do some apps not work when Network Protection is on?

Some websites and apps intentionally limit access to people using a VPN. For example, they may ask you to solve a CAPTCHA to ensure you\'re a real person instead of a bot. If you experience repeated issues with an app, you can exclude it from the VPN altogether under Network Protection settings.
Why can\'t I dismiss the Network Protection notifications?
Android requires that VPNs show a persistent notification while the VPN is enabled.
Is Network Protection compatible with App Tracking Protection?
Yes, both Network Protection and App Tracking Protection can be on at the same time. No other VPNs are compatible with DuckDuckGo App Tracking Protection.
Is Network Protection free to use?
Network Protection is free to use while in beta. Eventually it will be offered as a paid service.
The service is for limited and personal use only.

• This service is provided for your personal use only.
• You are responsible for all activity in the service that occurs on or through your device.
• This service may only be used through the DuckDuckGo app on the device on which you are given access. If you delete the DuckDuckGo app, you will lose access to the service.
• You may not use this service through a third-party client.
You agree to comply with all applicable laws, rules, and regulations.

• You agree that you will not use the service for any unlawful, illicit, criminal, or fraudulent purpose, or in any manner that could give rise to civil or criminal liability under applicable law.\n• You agree to comply with our DuckDuckGo Terms of Service, which are incorporated by reference.
You must be eligible to use this service.

• Access to this beta is randomly awarded. You are responsible for ensuring eligibility.\n• You must be at least 18 years old and live in a location where use of a VPN is legal in order to be eligible to use this service.
We provide this beta service as-is and without warranty.

• This service is provided as-is and without warranties or guarantees of any kind. \n• To the extent possible under applicable law, DuckDuckGo will not be liable for any damage or loss arising from your use of the service. In any event, the total aggregate liability of DuckDuckGo shall not exceed $25 or the equivalent in your local currency.\n• We may in the future transfer responsibility for the service to a subsidiary of DuckDuckGo. If that happens, you agree that references to “DuckDuckGo” will refer to our subsidiary, which will then become responsible for providing the service and for any liabilities relating to it.
We may terminate access at any time.

• We reserve the right to revoke access to the service at any time in our sole discretion.\n• We may also terminate access for violation of these terms, including for repeated infringement of the intellectual property rights of others.
The service is free during the beta period.
• Access to this service is currently free of charge, but that is limited to this beta period. \n• You understand and agree that this service is provided on a temporary, testing basis only.
We are continually updating the service.
• The service is in beta, and we are regularly changing it.\n• Service coverage, speed, server locations, and quality may vary without warning.

• You may be asked during the beta period to provide feedback about your experience. Doing so is optional and your feedback may be used to improve the service.\n• If you have enabled notifications for the DuckDuckGo app, we may use notifications to ask about your experience. You can disable notifications if you do not want to receive them.
We don’t ask for any personal information from you in order to use this beta service.
• This Privacy Policy is for our limited waitlist beta VPN product.\n• Our main Privacy Policy also applies here.
We don’t keep any logs of your online activity.

• That means we have no way to tie what you do online to you as an individual and we don’t have any record of things like:
	 • Website visits
	 • DNS requests
	 • Connections made
	 • IP addresses used
	 • Session lengths
We only keep anonymous performance metrics that we cannot connect to your online activity.

• Our servers store generic usage (for example, CPU load) and diagnostic data (for example, errors), but none of that data is connected to any individual’s activity.\n• We use this non-identifying information to monitor and ensure the performance and quality of the service, for example to make sure servers aren’t overloaded.
We use dedicated servers for all VPN traffic.

• Dedicated servers means they are not shared with anyone else.\n• We rent our servers from providers we carefully selected because they meet our privacy requirements.\n• We have strict access controls in place so that only limited DuckDuckGo team members have access to our servers.
We protect and limit use of your data when you communicate directly with DuckDuckGo.

• If you reach out to us for support by submitting a bug report or through email and agree to be contacted to troubleshoot the issue, we’ll contact you using the information you provide.\n• If you participate in a voluntary product survey or questionnaire and agree to provide further feedback, we may contact you using the information you provide.\n• We will permanently delete all personal information you provided to us (email, contact information), within 30 days after closing a support case or, in the case of follow up feedback, within 60 days after ending this beta service.
Network Protection is disabled. Tap to continue securing your device traffic.
A VPN app on your device disabled Network Protection. Tap to re-enable.
Automatically connect to the nearest server we can find
